ygData.subject: Re: Geographical Directory of Smithing...
ygData.msgSnippet: Most of my experience comes from being an ogre in Oggok, so here s what I ve found in that area. Oggok: forge in Metil Armer shop Feerrott: basic armor and
ygData.messageBody:
Most of my experience comes from being an ogre in Oggok, so here's what I've
found in that area.

Oggok:
forge in Metil Armer shop

Feerrott:
basic armor and lantern molds and 2 books (basic smithing and armor &
weapons) near the bridge to the Rathe Mountains

Grobb:
ore (all sizes) at a merchant near the shadowknight guild (Nightkeep)

Neriak:
file and other (not sure which) molds in the Foreign Quarter (2 ogre women)
ore (all sizes) at a merchant in the Commons from a merchant in an aquarium
type room near the bank (The Burnished Coin)

I had to go all the way to Neriak for misc. molds - ogres and trolls beware
of roaming NPC's with bad attitudes. I died several times in Neriak simply
because I made a wrong turn, so don't know what else may be there.

Zuug da Ogre Shaman (Bertoxxulous)


-----Original Message-----
From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 10:31 AM
Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Re: Geographical Directory of Smithing...


>From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
>
>I think many would appreciate it, and that it would benefit us all, if
>the smiths on the list could work together (through posting) to assmble
>a listing by zone location what items and/or equipment are available
>there as relating to smithing. For example, Rivervale doesn't sell ore
>but does have a few molds of various types available, and also does
>have a forge. Those with information of one zone or another, please
>ante up.
>
>Small pieces of ore, small blocks, large blocks
>Molds (what kind; especially file, skewer, scaler and armor molds)
>Forges
>Smithing in-game books (the books you buy on the subject)
>
>I'm interested how many areas actually enable one to smith without
>having to run back and forth between multiple zones.
>
>Thanks in advance
>
>Druther (9th Paladin, Tarrew Marr), Smith and Tailor.
>
>===
> :D
> Dave's World
